articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Korean April 26 Cartoon Film Studio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Korean April 26 Cartoon Film Studio
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, gave field guidance to the Korean April 26 Cartoon Film Studio. 
					 He said he was visiting the studio to bring about a fresh turn in animation and, through it, put the film making in full progress as the movies play an important role in educating the people, establishing the stirring atmosphere in society and propelling the revolution and construction.
					
					 He first went to the room dedicated to the history of the studio. The studio, founded at the initiative of President Kim Il Sung and under his guidance in September 1957, had developed into a leading animation producer under the energetic guidance and meticulous care of leader Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					 He said that the cartoon films produced at the studio are popular among not only children but people from different walks of life while gaining in popularity worldwide. He added that the people regard those films as their close companions in life and work.
					
					 Noting that the studio produced hundreds of cartoon films, including those adapted from stories told by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, and ordered and joint cartoons on a worldwide scale, he highly praised its animators for having creditably discharged the noble mission they assumed before the party and revolution.
					
					 He set forth important tasks after touring original picture atelier, background workroom, dubbing, recording, cutting and preview rooms and other places of the studio to learn in detail about the cartoon production.
					
					  He urged the studio to make a radical change in cartoon production by channeling big efforts into it true to the intention of the party.
					
					 It is needed to produce interesting cartoons of diverse themes and styles suited to the children's age and mental qualities and the Korean people's thoughts and feelings, he said, stressing that the creators should make a deep study of life and get intent on inquiry and speculation to produce more cartoons favored by the people. 
					
					 He stressed the need to make many cartoons on historical records so as to help youngsters and students and working people know well about the long history, brilliant culture and excellent traditions of the Korean nation. 
					
					 "The Boy General", a cartoon film in 50 parts produced by the studio, had won a great popularity, he said, adding that the children and other people in the country would be very glad to see it develop into a 100-part cartoon.
					
					 In order to produce successful cartoons, it is important to pick out right seed and theme, deviating from repetition and formulism, and construct the plot in an interesting way, he said.
					
					 He contended that it is necessary to reject in animation such tendency as amusing light and naturalism contrary to the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of literature and art and establish the political standard based on the view of Juche.
					
					 Underlining the need to put the modernization, scientization, computerization and digitalization of the studio on a higher level, he took benevolent measures for it. 
					
					 The DPRK's animation startles the world people for its originality, appeal, high level of depiction and rapid production speed, and its animators advanced into the world animation field from long ago, fully displaying the country's developed cartoon production technology with their distinguished skills, the supreme leader said, calling upon them to turn the DPRK into a leading animation producer of the world with high ambition.
					
					 Accompanying him in the visit were Secretary Kim Ki Nam, First Vice Department Director Ri Jae Il and vice department directors Kim Yo Jong and Kim Ui Sun of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Mongolian PM
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Mongolian PM
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Chimedin Saykhanbileg upon his appointment as prime minister of Mongolia.
					 The message wished the prime minister success in his future work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries favorably developing in recent years would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.title: Malaysian Political Party Leader Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Malaysian Political Party Leader Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak who is chairman of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia (UMNOM) on Monday met and had a talk with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of its Central Committee, participating in the Congress of the UMNOM.

articles.title: Greetings to United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
articles.content:
Greetings to United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on Thursday sent a congratulatory message to the Congress of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia (UMNOM).
					 The message said that the WPK is pleased that the UMNOM has registered many successes in the work for consolidating the national unity and achieving socio-economic development under the slogan "One Malaysia".
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the WPK and the UMNOM would grow stronger, it sincerely wished the UMNOM great success in the work of its congress.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting with Staff Members of Palestinian Embassy Held
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting with Staff Members of Palestinian Embassy Held
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with staff members of the Palestinian embassy here took place at DPRK-Palestine Friendship Tongdaewon Senior Secondary School in Tongdaewon District on Thursday to mark the 26th anniversary of the proclamation of the State of Palestine and the year of the world solidarity with the Palestinian people.
					 Present there on invitation were Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 On hand were officials of the DPRK-Palestine Friendship and Solidarity Committee and teachers and students of the school.
					
					 After being briefed on the school at the room dedicated to its history, the participants looked round its various places.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by its students.

articles.title: More Rallies of Service Personnel and People Held
articles.content:
More Rallies of Service Personnel and People Held
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- More rallies of service personnel and people were held in North Phyongan, North Hamgyong and South Hwanghae provinces on Thursday to support the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK and vow to mercilessly foil the heinous anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the U.S. and its followers.
					 Present there were officials of the local party, power and economic bodies and working people's organizations, service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, people from all walks of life, youth and students.
					
					 The statement of the NDC of the DPRK was read out. Speeches were made by representatives of the KPA, workers, agricultural workers and youth students.
					
					 The speakers said the service personnel and people of the DPRK categorically deny and reject the "human rights resolution" the U.S. and its followers cooked up by abusing the UN, demanding the U.S. make a formal apology for its crime.
					
					 They said the U.S. is the sworn enemy of the Korean people who inflicted untold misfortunes and agonies upon them by pursuing various type hostile policies toward the DPRK to isolate it politically, impose economic sanctions upon it and stifle it by force of arms.
					
					 They called for wiping out to the very last one the enemies including the U.S. and Park Geun Hye group who are running amuck to bring down the inviolable DPRK highly dignified for its independence and powerful thanks to its self-reliant defence capabilities and self-supporting economy.
					
					 They renewed their firm will to turn out in the all-people resistance once supreme leader Kim Jong Un issues an order, and achieve the final victory of Songun Korea in the showdown with the U.S.
					
					 The meetings were followed by demonstrations.

articles.title: Korean Youth and Trade Union Members Meet
articles.content:
Korean Youth and Trade Union Members Meet
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Meetings of members of the young vanguard, and officials and members of the trade unions were separately held on Thursday at the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre and Jonsung Revolutionary Site to support the statement of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and vow to mercilessly frustrate the heinous "human rights" racket of the U.S. and its allies.
					 They were attended by officials concerned and officials of the youth league and trade unions, youth and students and workers and members of trade unions.
					
					 The statement of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK was read out at the meetings.
					
					 Speakers said it is nothing but a pipedream of the fools that the U.S. and its stooges are running amuck to bring down the world's best socialist system in the DPRK by kicking up the frantic smear campaign.
					
					 The so-called "human rights resolution" which the UN adopted under the manipulation of the U.S. in a bid to infringe upon the sovereignty of the DPRK can never work on it which enjoys high dignity thanks to its independence and demonstrates its might thanks to its self-reliance in defence and self-support in economy, the speakers noted.
					
					 They expressed their determination to mercilessly frustrate the heinous "human rights" farce of the U.S. and all other hostile forces as declared at the statement of the NDC of the DPRK.
					
					 They called for turning out as one in the toughest counteraction so that they may show the above-said forces what high price they will have to pay for having hurt the dignity of the DPRK in a foolish bid to bring down the socialist system, the cradle of the Korean people.
					
					 There took place a grand march of members of the young vanguard at the end of their meeting.

articles.title: More Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
More Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Palace of Sun
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and agricultural workers from across the country planted trees of good species in the Arboretum of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 More than 8 900 trees and saplings of fifteen species and at least 8 500 flower plant roots and seeds of five species were planted by officials of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, officials of the union and agricultural workers in Pyongyang City, cities (districts) and counties of South and North Phyongan and North Hwanghae provinces.

articles.title: National Exhibition and Presentation in Field of Pomiculture Held
articles.content:
National Exhibition and Presentation in Field of Pomiculture Held
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition and presentation in the field of pomiculture took place here from Nov. 25 to 27.
					 Present there were scientists, technicians and officials of production units and science and education institutions in the field of pomiculture.
					
					 Presented there were successes they made in their scientific researches and production.
					
					 Drawing the attention of the participants were sci-tech successes conducive to safely cultivating fruit trees and increasing production.
					
					 Also presented there were more than 130 papers that can solve the issues arising in realizing the comprehensive mechanization in fruit farming.

articles.title: 10th National Symposium on Kyongrak Theory Held
articles.content:
10th National Symposium on Kyongrak Theory Held
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The 10th National Symposium on Kyongrak Theory was held at the Academy of Koryo Medicine on Nov. 26 and 27 under the sponsorship of the C.C., the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 It was attended by scientists, teachers and medical workers in the field of public health studying Kyongrak theory at Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, the Academy of Koryo Medicine, Kang Kon Sariwon Medical Collage and the South Phyongan Provincial People's Hospital.
					
					 The meeting heard the elucidation of the origin of Kyongrak theory and dozens of successes and experience gained in treating the incurable diseases by acupuncture and moxibustion.

articles.title: Functional Stone-patterned Tile Developed
articles.content:
Functional Stone-patterned Tile Developed
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Ryujong center for exchange and development of solvent technology in the DPRK has recently developed functional stone-patterned tile favorable for human health, which draws great attention of architects.
					 The tile has proved effective in preventing air pollution while giving aesthetic impression as natural stone, according to Kim Ryong Jin, director of the center.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The tile is a mixture of such functional materials as Kumgang medical stone, tourmaline, diatomite and light-burned magnesia clinker. Kumgang medical stone, which includes over 50 kinds of microelements like zinc, iron and manganese, helps promoting hematopoietic function in human body.
					
					 The tile is several times stronger than activated charcoal in adsorbing bad smells and has functions of purifying air, radiating far-infrared rays, controlling humidity and absorbing sound.
					
					 It has been presented to several international expositions, enjoying popularity as a green building material.

articles.title: Famous Historical Inventions of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Famous Historical Inventions of Korean Nation
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation has created great material and cultural wealth from old times, making contributions to the development of human culture.
					 Especially, the Korean nation made many inventions well-known over the world, including Chomsongdae (Astronomical Observatory), metal type, iron-clad turtle ship and iron-made rain gauge.
					
					 Chomsongdae built in the first half of the 7th century is the oldest among the remains of astronomical observatories in the world.
					
					 The metal type, believed to be invented for printing in the period of Koryo Kingdom (918-1392), gives a glimpse of high metal casting and working skill of the Korean nation.
					
					 The Korean nation built Turtle Ship, an iron-clad warship, in the 16th century for the first time in the history of the world and invented the iron-made rain gauge in 1441, nearly 200 years earlier than Europeans.

articles.title: Imperialists' "Human Rights" Racket Is Prelude to War: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Imperialists' "Human Rights" Racket Is Prelude to War: KCNA Commentary
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission of the DPRK in a statement on Nov. 23 solemnly declared before the world that it would regard the "human rights resolution" railroaded by the U.S. and its followers through the UN as an unprecedented and undisguised declaration of war and launch the toughest-ever counteraction to cope with it.
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to clarify this resolute stand.
					
					 This is because the "human rights" campaign kicked up by the imperialists is no more than a prelude to invasion to be inevitably followed by a war, which might lead to such a tragic situation as the collapse of a legitimate government with its sovereignty mercilessly encroached upon.
					
					 After the end of the Cold War, the imperialists lost its pretext for committing aggression and igniting a war. Then, they noisily trumpeted about "the protection of human rights" as a lever for doing so.
					
					 Styling themselves an "apostle of human rights", they perpetrated military intervention in other countries as they pleased.
					
					 The U.S. ignited the Yugoslav war in 1999 under the signboard of "protecting human rights and minority." The U.S. started the Afghan and Iraqi wars in the new century, claiming they were to bring "freedom", "democracy" and "prosperity" to the peoples of those countries.
					
					 But the reality was quite contrary to its claim.
					
					 The countries against which the U.S. ignited wars under the pretext of "human rights" were all reduced to tundra of human rights and scenes of humanitarian disasters. Division of nations and confrontation between them festered and the peoples of those countries suffered from a nightmare of ceaseless misfortunes and agonies. 
					
					 The "Arab spring" and "color revolution" spread by the imperialists in various countries and regions of the world under the slogan of "protecting human rights", without exception, led to the battles for toppling governments, causing political instability, economic disorder and social chaos.
					
					 As seen above, the human rights farce of the imperialists is nothing but a guide to aggression as it is aimed to ignite a war and inflict untold death and disaster upon the peoples.
					
					 This being a hard reality, we cannot but question those countries who blindly voted for the "human rights resolution" sponsored by the imperialists through high-handed and arbitrary practices at the UN.
					
					 Have they ever thought of the horrible disasters the imperialists' "human rights" racket might bring to their countries and nations next time? 
					
					 Now that the imperialists declared a war by staging the hideous "human rights" burlesque, the DPRK is determined to smash it through its toughest counteraction.
					
					 The chief authors of the "resolution" and all those involved in its fabrication are the targets of the DPRK's counteraction.
					
					 The hearts of all the service personnel and people of the DPRK are burning with the determination to retaliate against them because the "resolution" dared hurt the inviolable dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, the thrice-cursed crime.
					
					 The U.S. is their primary target.
					
					 The U.S. anxiously watched for a chance to ignite a war against the DPRK under the pretext of the nuclear issue. Finding its scenario unworkable, Washington worked hard to use the "human rights issue" of the DPRK as a pretext for launching armed intervention and igniting a new war of aggression. The DPRK will force it to pay for such crimes to the end.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon the noisy "human rights" racket of the U.S. and its followers -- this is its firm stand.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Trying to Dissolve Opposition Party
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces Accused of Trying to Dissolve Opposition Party
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Unified Progressive Party, an opposition party of south Korea, held a general meeting of lawmakers from the party on Nov. 25 at which it denounced the puppet forces for trying to dissolve it, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Lawmakers from the party termed the present "government's" motion calling for judgment for dissolving the political party an act going against democracy.
					
					 No one can judge the efforts of the party for the national reconciliation and cooperation, and peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula, they said.
					
					 They urged the "government" to cancel the motion.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Denounced for Her Moves to Institute "Unification Charter"
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Denounced for Her Moves to Institute "Unification Charter"
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea Tuesday issued a statement denouncing the Park Geun Hye group for its moves to institute the "unification charter".
					 The statement accused Park Geun Hye of holding a meeting of the "preparatory committee for unification" on Oct. 13 at which she cried out for instituting the "unification charter" as early as possible.
					
					 The "unification charter" touted by Park is the one for division against reunification and the one for war as it calls for confrontation between compatriots, the source of war disaster, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The "unification charter" is nothing but an arrangement for pushing forward the revision of the constitution in the style of the second "yusin constitution" nothing relevant to the national reconciliation, cooperation and reunification.
					
					 The "charter for national education" instituted by Park Chung-Hee was the spiritual roots of the "yusin" dictatorship and political starting-point of the "yusin" system.
					
					 Park Geun Hye aims to lay a springboard for the long-term office by pushing forward the revision of the constitution in the style of the second "yusin constitution" under the pretext for instituting the "unification charter".

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Regime Urged to Halt Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Regime Urged to Halt Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China made public a statement on Nov. 25 in denunciation of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces.
					 The criminal "human rights resolution" against the DPRK fabricated by the U.S. and its followers is an unpardonable insult and challenge to the dignity of the DPRK and its socialist system and people, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The puppet forces zealously joined the U.S. in fabricating the "resolution" in a bid to defame the high prestige and influence of the DPRK, justify their confrontation with fellow countrymen, put the people's mindset under control and tide over their ruling crisis.
					
					 Park Geun Hye had better abandon a foolish dream of bringing down the most advantageous socialist system centered on the popular masses and breaking their single-minded unity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Malaysia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Malaysia
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Malaysia on Nov. 21.
					 Chong Chingchi, manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize round-table talks, lecture, photo exhibition, film show and other political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il from Nov. 21 to Dec. 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Malaysian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Malaysian Figure 
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Chong Chingchi, manager of Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia, said at an inaugural ceremony of the committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il that he was a peerless patriot and great revolutionary. 
					 Chong was elected chairman of the committee. He paid the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il who devoted himself to the happiness of the Korean people and the defence of the sovereignty of the country. 
					
					 The international community highly praises him as a prominent thinker and theoretician and the greatest man, the chairman said, adding:
					
					 Though HE Kim Jong Il passed away, he is always alive in the hearts of the progressive people for his undying exploits.

articles.title: Uruguayan Paper Introduces May Day Stadium in DPRK
articles.content:
Uruguayan Paper Introduces May Day Stadium in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on Nov. 16 carried an article introducing the world-level May Day Stadium of the DPR of Korea. 
					 The construction of the May Day Stadium was completed in 1989, the article said, introducing seating capacity, floor space, sports and cultural and welfare facilities and service networks of the stadium. 
					
					 Football and other sports games and the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" were held at the stadium, the article said, adding:
					
					 The stadium was successfully remolded in October as a monumental edifice in the era of the Workers' Party thanks to the initiative and guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: UK Organizations Condemn U.S. and Its Followers for Their "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
UK Organizations Condemn U.S. and Its Followers for Their "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK made public a joint statement on Nov. 20 in denunciation of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the U.S. and its followers. 
					 The statement branded the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" cooked up by the U.S. and its following forces at the UN a mockery of justice. 
					
					 Categorically rejecting the "resolution" fabricated according to the U.S. scenario, the statement said it was a product of the U.S. moves to stifle Korean-style socialism at any cost. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are using the UN as a tool for realizing its ambition to stifle the DPRK, it noted. 
					
					 The anti-DPRK "resolution" is based on sheer lies, it pointed out. 
					
					 The testimonies were made by a handful of "defectors from north Korea" who fled it after committing crimes there or were allured, it said.
					
					 The "resolution" did not reflect the will of the Korean people at all, it noted. 
					
					 We know well that the U.S. and its followers are the worst human rights abusers in the world, it stressed. 
					
					 The "human rights issue" can never exist in the DPRK guided by the Juche idea, it said. 
					
					 We fully support the stand of the DPRK to bolster up war deterrence unlimitedly to cope with the U.S. moves for armed intervention and invasion, it noted, adding:
					
					 The world progressives should get united to smash the U.S. "human rights" racket against the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings and a film show took place in Benin, Ethiopia and Angola from Nov. 11 to 18 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present at the events were members of the committee of the Socialist Party of Benin for honoring the memory of Kim Jong Il, the branches of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and an Angolan company and masses.
					
					 Films shown included the Korean film "Monument to Party Founding".
					
					 The chairman of the said committee of the Socialist Party of Benin said the Workers' Party of Korea had grown to be an integral organization and the party which achieved the unity of actions under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The chief of a branch of the said Ethiopian national committee praised Kim Jong Il as the greatest man, adding that as Kim Jong Il passed away all of a sudden, the world lost the most outstanding leader.
					
					 The general director of the Angolan company said exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the human cause of independence would throw their bright rays thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Russian Figure Accuses U.S. of Abusing Human Rights for Attacking Other Countries
articles.content:
Russian Figure Accuses U.S. of Abusing Human Rights for Attacking Other Countries
 Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- Posted on 4th Media, internet homepage of China, on November 20 was an article titled "'Human Rights' as the Number One U.S. Weapon to Attack Any Nation Who Dares to Challenge Its Imperial Aggression" by Alexander Vorontsov, head of the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russia Academy of Sciences.
					 The article said: 
					
					 The U.S. and its allies have added systematic attacks on North Korea's human-rights record to their traditional arsenal of tactics for exerting pressure on that country. These attacks have been launched before, but lately they have become more extensive than ever, and the "human-rights offensive" itself now looks like a carefully designed, long-term strategy.
					
					 The first element in this strategy was the North Korean Human Rights Act passed by the U.S. Congress-yet another example of American lawmakers interfering in the internal affairs of another state.
					
					 Then a certain Committee for Human Rights in North Korea, based in the U.S., published its "Report on Human Rights in North Korea", which urges the UN Security Council to officially address this issue.
					
					 It also recommends that the UN General Assembly pass a corresponding resolution in order to convince the international community that North Korea is an "evil regime with no place in the modern world", a "land of darkness, where there are no human rights," and that correspondingly punitive measures should be taken.
					
					 This truly seems like the run-up to an international punitive operation against the North Korean state.
					
					 Pyongyang, in turn, has made a number of strong statements in response to Washington's actions.
					
					 An English-language statement ("DPRK Will Mercilessly Shatter U.S. and Its Followers' 'Human Rights' Campaign") issued by the North Korean National Defence Commission on Oct. 25, 2014, states in part:
					
					 "First, Now that the U.S. 'human rights' offensive against the DPRK has reached an extreme phase, the DPRK formally notifies the U.S. that the DPRK will settle accounts with those related to the offensive without the slightest clemency and by every possible means and methods generation after generation."
					
					 "Second, Now that the U.S. anti-DPRK 'human rights' campaign is leading to a vicious plot to bring down the dignified social system in the DPRK, it declares its new tough counter-action of its own style to frustrate the campaign of the U.S. and its allied forces."
					
					 "Third, The army and people of the DPRK call upon the world to thoroughly shatter the sinister cooperation for aggression sought by the U.S. and its followers under the pretext of the 'human rights issue' through anti-U.S. cooperation based on justice and truth." (From a statement by the North Korean National Defence Commission)
					
					 Despite this deterioration in the state of affairs, Pyongyang has continued to seek out new approaches to starting a dialog with the South. And the northerners have once again shown their ability to do things in a novel way.
					
					 The first such step, a surprise to most observers, was when a large delegation of North Korean athletes arrived at the international Asian Games in the South Korean city of Incheon (Sept. 19 - Oct. 4, 2014), where they gave an impressive performance.
					
					 The North Korean competitors won 36 medals - 11 of them gold - and they set four world records. North Korea's women's soccer team took first place at the Asian Games.
					
					 However, the biggest bombshell was still to come. On Oct. 4, politicians and experts were stunned when North Korea's highest officials arrived in the South Korean city of Incheon for the closing ceremony of the international Asian Games.
					
					 This was more than just a ceremonial visit - it was an extraordinary mission, personally authorized by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Given the current situation, it would obviously be difficult to imagine a clearer sign of Pyongyang's willingness to resume a substantive inter-Korean dialog. The value of this gesture is even more obvious because shortly before the sensational appearance of the North Korean trio in Incheon, Seoul had proposed that high-level talks be resumed.
					
					 That happened on Aug. 11, 2014, the day before scheduled U.S.-South Korean military maneuvers, but Seoul understood that the North's answer could only come after these maneuvers had ended.
					
					 The "North Korean trio's quick spurt" down South, while raising hopes, confronted Seoul with a number of issues, including, according to some observers, the question of a possible inter-Korean summit. Everyone who follows the twists and turns on the Korean Peninsula was waiting with bated breath to see if perhaps a serious positive shift, if not a breakthrough, would occur in inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Unfortunately, this initiative to bring the two Korean states closer together has run into resistance from those who are committed to old and unproductive political games.
					
					 The National Defence Commission of the DPRK felt compelled to remind Seoul that it would not be possible to hold the high-level meetings that had been scheduled for the end of October, 2014, in view of the fact that even on the eve of this important, and previously arranged meeting, balloons stuffed with anti- Pyongyang propaganda continued to be released from the South to be blown into the North.
					
					 This is not a new problem. For several years now, beginning with the Lee Myung-bak administration in Seoul, the practice of "firing" propaganda balloons into North Korea has become a regular event. A few specific NGOs are behind this, and although not numerous, they are quite active and vociferous.
					
					 Pyongyang's numerous protests and warnings to South Korea are ignored under the pretext that it is a democratic state, and a democracy cannot suppress the actions of nongovernmental organizations.
					
					 But the South Korean democracy seems indifferent to the rights of its own citizens living on the North Korean border (for example, in the South Korean city of Paju), where the local residents adamantly protest the actions of anti-North Korean groups that use their town as a launching pad for the balloons.
					
					 What conclusions can be drawn from all this?
					
					 Until Washington turns away from a paradigm based on regime change in the DPRK as soon as possible and at any cost, the door leading toward an improved relationship between the two Koreas will quickly begin to close.
					
					And yet it is the Koreans themselves who will have the last word in determining the fate of their divided people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita los Estudios de Dibujos Animados 26 de Abril de Corea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita los Estudios de Dibujos Animados 26 de Abril de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 27 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio sobre el terreno los Estudios de Dibujos Animados 26 de Abril de Corea.
					El sector cinematografico desempena gran papel en educar a los habitantes, animar el ambiente de la sociedad e impulsar la revolucion y la construccion, dijo y agrego que vino a los estudios para imprimir nuevo viraje en la produccion de dibujos animados y convertirlo en la chispa de la revolucion cinematografica.
					
					Recorrio primero la sala de presentacion del historial.
					
					Los Estudios de Dibujos Animados 26 de Abril, fundados en septiembre de 1957 por la iniciativa del Presidente Kim Il Sung y bajo su direccion, se desarrollaron como afamada base de creacion de dibujos animados bajo la energica direccion y la profunda atencion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, recordo.
					
					Continuo que los dibujos animados creados aqui son companeros intimos no solo de los ninos sino tambien de los habitantes de diferentes sectores y se eleva sin parar la fama internacional de esos filmes.
					
					Los creadores y artistas de los estudios produjeron cientos de munequitos, inclusive los adaptados de los cuentos narrados por el Presidente y el Dirigente, y los pedidos y coproducidos en escala mundial, apunto y evaluo mucho los meritos de ellos que cumplen exitosamente su noble mision asumida ante el Partido y la revolucion.
					
					Kim Jong Un paso revista a las salas de creacion de pinturas originales de los colectivos No.1 y No.2 y las de creacion de dibujos de fondo, postsineronizacion, grabacion de parlamento, edicion y preestreno donde averiguo en detalles el estado de produccion y presento las tareas importantes.
					
					Subrayo que en acato a la voluntad del Partido, los estudios deben esforzarse mas por la creacion y registrar asi nuevo cambio revolucionario.
					
					Dijo que deben crear los interesantes dibujos animados con varios temas y formas de acuerdo con las caracteristicas psicologicas de los ninos de diferentes edades y la idea e idiosincrasia de nuestro pueblo y para ello, los creadores deben estudiar profundamente la vida y meditar constantemente para crear mas dibujos animados favoritos del pueblo.
					
					Instruyo crear muchos dibujos animados con  temas historicos para que los jovenes y ninos escolares y los trabajadores sepan bien la larga historia, la brillante cultura y la tradicion sobresaliente de nuestra nacion.
					
					Agrego que tuvo gran popularidad "El nino hercules" de 50 partes, producido aqui, y se pondrian muy contentos los ninos y los habitantes si lo alargan hasta 100 partes.
					
					Para crear bien los dibujos animados, deben liberarse de la repeticion y el esquematismo, escoger bien la semilla y el tema y desenvolver de manera interesante la historia de peliculas infantiles, acoto.
					
					Enfatizo que se debe rechazar el egocentrismo de interes y naturalismo que contravienen a la politica del Partido sobre el arte y la literatura, y mantener bien la entereza politica desde el autoctono punto de vista.
					
					Dio la indicacion de realizar en un nivel mas alto la modernizacion, la cienfitizacion, la computarizacion y la digitalizacion de los Estudios de Dibujos Animados 26 de Abril y tomo las medidas para cumplir esas tareas.
					
					Kim Jong Un dijo que nuestros dibujos animados asombran a todo el mundo por su originalidad, atractivo, alto nivel de descripcion y rapida velocidad de creacion y desde mucho antes, nuestros creadores demuestran plenamente nuestra tecnica de produccion trabajando con sus excepcionales talentos en el circulo mundial de dibujos animados.
					
					Hay que tener la ambicion de convertir nuestro pais en una potencia de dibujos animados de talla mundial, concluyo.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Jae Il, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Yo Jong y Kim Ui Sun.

articles.title: CC del PTC felicita Congreso de Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia
articles.content:
CC del PTC felicita Congreso de Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia
						
Pyongyang, 27 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 27 un mensaje de felicitacion al Congreso de la Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia.
					El texto expresa satisfaccion de que bajo la consigna de "Una Malasia", la Organizacion Nacional de Malayos Unidos de Malasia logra muchos exitos en las labores para consolidar la  unidad nacional y alcanzar el desarrollo socioeconomico.
					
					Convencido de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre las organizaciones politicas de los dos paises, el mensaje desea con sinceridad mayores exitos en el trabajo del Congreso del partido malayo.

articles.title: Efectuados mitines de jovenes y gremiales contra alboroto de "DDHH" de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Efectuados mitines de jovenes y gremiales contra alboroto de "DDHH" de EE.UU.
						
Pyongyang, 27 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 mitines de los jovenes, funcionarios y miembros de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea para apoyar la declaracion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y frustrar la farsa de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos y sus fuerzas seguidoras.
					Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios de ramas interesadas, la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y la FGSC, los jovenes y estudiantes, los obreros y los gremiales.
					
					En los mitines efectuados respectivamente en el Anfiteatro del Parque Juventud y el Lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Jonsung, se dio lectura a la declaracion del CDN de la RPDC y hubo discursos.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el imperialismo norteamericano y sus lacayos se entregan a los alborotos intrigantes anti-RPDC para derrumbar el regimen socialista de Corea mas ventajoso en el mundo y agregaron que tal campana no pasa de ser una vana ilusion.
					
					Subrayaron que la "resolucion de DDHH" de la ONU aprobada a instigacion de EE.UU. para acabar con la soberania de la RPDC no surtira  ningun efecto.
					
					Enfatizaron que frustraran sin piedad la farsa de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU. y las fuerzas hostiles como habian proclamado en la declaracion del CDN.
					
					Exhortaron a todos a levantarse como un solo hombre en la confrontacion super-intransigente para mostrar a los enloquecidos en destruir el regimen socialista, cuna de vida del pueblo coreano, cual amargo resultado producira su atrevida ofensiva a la dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					En el mitin de los jovenes hubo manifestacion de los vanguardistas juveniles.
